docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 21 -- By ten votes to five, with three abstentions, the United Nations Economic and Social Council indicated today its intention of recommending to the General Assembly the adoption of Spanish as a working language for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 21 -- By ten votes to five, with three abstentions, the United Nations Economic and Social Council indicated today its intention of recommending to the General Assembly the adoption of Spanish as a working language for the Council, in addition to English and French.

headline.main: SPANISH IS FAVORED FOR USE BY U. N. GROUP

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 21 -- British shipbuilding has declined this summer after a spring quarter during which an unusually high number of sixty-eight vessels totaling 405,600 tons were completed, Lloyd's Register announced today. Work was begun on only...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 21 -- British shipbuilding has declined this summer after a spring quarter during which an unusually high number of sixty-eight vessels totaling 405,600 tons were completed, Lloyd's Register announced today. Work was begun on only fifty-seven ships during April, May and June but the Register said "such periodic fluctuations are to be expected."
docs.abstract: Lloyd's 2d qr rept shows GB still leads world in bldg despite 10% drop; 405,600 tons completed, 2,076,241 under construction

docs.snippet: HELSINKI, Finland, July 23 -- Two more gold medals in men's track and field, making a total of ten, and victories for the Navy eight-oared crew and the Rutgers pair without coxswain in the rowing finals, marked another afternoon of conspicuous...
docs.lead_paragraph: HELSINKI, Finland, July 23 -- Two more gold medals in men's track and field, making a total of ten, and victories for the Navy eight-oared crew and the Rutgers pair without coxswain in the rowing finals, marked another afternoon of conspicuous success for the United States in the Games of the Fifteenth Olympiad today.
